intro: Epilobium nesophilum var. lupulinum, commonly known as the alpine willow herb, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Epilobium nesophilum var. lupulinum is notable for its ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators.
